text.eng: Click Submit if you are satisfied with the data collected, or click Cancel if you wish to run more experiments.\n\nOnce you click Submit, you will not be able to run any more experiments.

text.spa: Haga clic en el botón Siguiente para continuar.
Haga clic en el botón COMENZAR para continuar.

text.eng: Please answer the question and click Submit to continue.
text.spa: Por favor responder a la pregunta y haga clic en el botón Enviar para continuar.

text.eng: Please answer the question and then click Submit to continue.
text.spa: Por favor responder a la pregunta y haga clic en el botón Enviar para continuar.

text.eng:
You are going to have a party, and you want to use a bubble machine to create bubbles for the party.

Your goal is to get the bubble machine to make the biggest bubbles.

Click Begin to get started.
You will be working with a simulation of the bubble machine. The simulation will help you figure out how to get the biggest bubbles for the party.
To get the biggest bubbles, you can change controls on the bubble machine:
Buttons A and B change the bubble mixture.
Numbers on the dial change the fan speed.

Now, you can practice using the simulation.

Change the fan speed to 3.

Press Run to test the bubble machine.
The bubble machine settings and the average bubble diameter are recorded for you.
Now you are ready to use the bubble machine. Your job is to figure out how to make the biggest bubbles.
You must decide how many experiments to do, but you can't do more than 15 experiments.
When you think you are finished, click Submit to go on.
Based on your experiments, what settings should be used to create the largest bubbles?
Your friend has entered the average bubble size for both bubble mixtures and all fan speeds into a spreadsheet.
Your friend wants to know how the choice of fan speed and bubble mixture affects the bubble size.
Create a chart that shows the relationship between fan speed, bubble mixture, and bubble size.
To create a chart, click Create Chart and choose the best chart for your needs. Click Submit when you are finished.
How does the choice of fan speed and bubble mixture affect bubble size?
Select the correct answer below. You can use the information in the spreadsheet to help you choose the right answer. Click Submit when you are finished.
The lower the fan speed, the bigger the bubbles for Mixtures A and B.
The higher the fan speed, the bigger the bubbles for Mixtures A and B.
After a certain speed is reached, increasing the fan speed makes the bubbles smaller for Mixtures A and B.
The bubbles produced by Mixture A are always smaller than the bubbles produced by Mixture B.
You are now ready to make big bubbles for the party!
